column1: Art Institute of Chicago////When I come to portraits
column2: I imagine the personalities behind the paintings as there always must be a painter and a subject. And more often than not there's a history
column3: nudity automatically creates an alternate universe and way of relating as does a rental agreement. Strangely
column6: painters painting for their lodging and being evicted because of the end result. Painting like this apparently leads to homelessness-she was either very ugly or the painter more in need of a model than a roof.
